HCQ and CQ are weak basic drugs that accumulate in the acidic environment of cellular organelles to inhibit replication of different viruses by interfering with endosome/lysosome trafficking or viral protein maturation during virion maturation. HCQ and CQ are well-known autophagy pathway inhibitors. protein 3 (NALP3) inhibits ROS-mediated inflammtory cytokine expression. autophagy also inhibits MAVS aggregation to downregulate type I IFN production. the detailed role of autophagy in virus replication remains to be validated. the late stage of interference in virion maturation might not be the major mechanism of HCQ anti-DENV-2 activity. HCQ preventive treatment in the area or season of a dengue pandemic might be a feasible strategy to reduce the severity and spread of DENV outbreak.
